info.name: MBankingCore API Collection
info.description:
API testing collection for MBankingCore with comprehensive endpoint coverage.

## Features:
- ðŸ” JWT Authentication (Android, iOS, Web, Desktop)
- ðŸ“± Device session management
- ðŸ”„ Automated token refresh
- âœ… Comprehensive API coverage
- ðŸ“ Article management (CRUD)
- ðŸŽ¯ Onboarding content management
- ðŸ“¸ Photo gallery management
- âš™ï¸ Config management system
- ðŸ“‹ Terms & Conditions management
- ðŸ” Privacy Policy management
- ðŸ‘¥ User management (Admin)
- ðŸ§ª Testing scenarios

## API Coverage (41 endpoints):
- **Public APIs** (7 endpoints)
  - Health Check (1)
  - Terms & Conditions (2)
  - Privacy Policy (2)
  - Onboarding (2)
- **Authentication APIs** (9 endpoints)
- **Protected User APIs** (8 endpoints)
- **Admin Management APIs** (13 endpoints)

## Testing Order:
1. **Public APIs** - No authentication required
2. **Authentication** - Register, Login, Token management
3. **Protected APIs** - User profile, sessions
4. **Admin APIs** - User management, content management

## Usage:
1. Import environment file: `MBankingCore-API.postman_environment.json`
2. Run collection with automated token handling
3. Test all API endpoints systematically

## Authentication Flow:
1. Register â†’ Get tokens
2. Login from different devices â†’ Multiple sessions
3. Access protected endpoints â†’ Auto token refresh
4. Test CRUD operations on all resources
5. Logout selectively â†’ Per device or all devices

body.raw:
{
    "content": "# Terms and Conditions

## 1. Introduction
Welcome to MBankingCore API. By using our service, you agree to comply with and be bound by the following terms and conditions.

## 2. Use License
Permission is granted to temporarily access our service for personal, non-commercial transitory viewing only.

## 3. Disclaimer
The materials on our service are provided on an 'as is' basis. We make no warranties, expressed or implied.

## 4. Limitations
In no event shall MBankingCore or its suppliers be liable for any damages arising out of the use or inability to use our service.

## 5. Accuracy of Materials
The materials appearing on our service could include technical, typographical, or photographic errors.

## 6. Contact Information
For questions about these Terms and Conditions, please contact our support team.

---
*Last updated: July 2025*"
}

request.description:
Register a new user with device session tracking.

**Features:**
- Creates user account with device session
- Returns access & refresh tokens
- Device-specific session tracking
- Automatic token extraction to environment

**Device Info:**
- device_type: web, android, ios, desktop
- Unique device_id for session tracking
- Device metadata for identification

exec: console.log('ðŸ“± Android tokens saved to environment');
console.log('ðŸ“± Generated Android Device ID:', deviceId);

request.description:
Login from Android device - creates separate session.

**Multi-Device Testing:**
- Different device_id from web registration
- Separate token pair for Android device
- Concurrent sessions with web device
- Independent session management

exec: console.log('ðŸ“± iOS tokens saved to environment');
console.log('ðŸ“± Generated iOS Device ID:', deviceId);

request.description:
Login from iOS device - creates third concurrent session.

**Now we have:**
- Web session (from registration)
- Android session
- iOS session

All active simultaneously for the same user.

Get all active sessions for current user.

**Expected Result:**
- List of all device sessions
- device_type information for each session
- Device metadata
- Session status and timestamps

Refresh access token for Android device.

**Device-Specific Refresh:**
- Uses Android device refresh token
- Only refreshes Android session tokens
- Other device sessions remain unaffected

item.description: Authentication endpoints with device session management.

request.description: Get current user's profile information.
Update user profile information.

exec: // Test that all sessions are invalidated
console.log('ðŸš« All device sessions have been invalidated');
// Clear all tokens since sessions are invalidated

request.description:
Change user password. This will invalidate ALL device sessions for security.

**Security Feature:**
- All active sessions across all devices are terminated
- User must re-login on all devices
- Prevents unauthorized access if password was compromised

item.name: ðŸšª Logout & Session Management

exec: console.log('âœ… Android device logged out successfully');
console.log('ðŸŒ Web and iOS sessions should remain active');

request.description:
Logout from Android device only.

**Selective Logout:**
- Only terminates Android device session
- Web and iOS sessions remain active
- Demonstrates device-specific session management

exec: pm.test('Android session should be removed', function () {

request.description: Verify that Android session is removed but others remain active.

exec: console.log('âœ… All devices logged out successfully');

request.description:
Logout from ALL devices.

**Global Logout:**
- Terminates all active sessions
- Invalidates all tokens across all devices
- Full security logout

item.description: Session management and logout endpoints with selective device control.
